Line 163: Line 163:
[[Zahi Hawass]], an internationally known [[archeologist]], was appointed by Mubarak to the newly created post of Minister of Antiquities during the cabinet shakeup on 31 January. Hawasss said in a statement published on his personal blog that "the broken objects can all be restored, and we will begin the restoration process this week".<ref name="hawass-update">{{cite web|url=http://www.drhawass.com/blog/state-egyptian-antiquities-today-update|title=The State of Egyptian Antiquities Today: An Update|date=February 1, 2011|work=Dr.hawass.com|accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref>
[[Zahi Hawass]], an internationally known [[archeologist]], was appointed by Mubarak to the newly created post of Minister of Antiquities during the cabinet shakeup on 31 January. Hawasss said in a statement published on his personal blog that "the broken objects can all be restored, and we will begin the restoration process this week".<ref name="hawass-update">{{cite web|url=http://www.drhawass.com/blog/state-egyptian-antiquities-today-update|title=The State of Egyptian Antiquities Today: An Update|date=February 1, 2011|work=Dr.hawass.com|accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref>
